snippet: Researchers suggested that the reduction was largely a result of equipment upgrades, including replacement of leaky old cast-iron or unprotected steel pipe.
abstract: Study published in journal Environmental Science & Technology finds natural gas utilities are making progress in reducing methane leaks, down 36 to 70 percent below 2011 Environmental Protection Agency estimates; methane is powerful greenhouse gas.
lead_paragraph: Researchers suggested that the reduction was largely a result of equipment upgrades, including replacement of leaky old cast-iron or unprotected steel pipe.

headline.main: Gas Utilities Reduce Leaks of Methane, Study Finds
